subjectDescription: Discover a full suite of online business courses that will allow you to make better business decisions and succeed in today's competitive business world. Our courses provide a rich learning experience that will allow you to develop critical business skills in areas such as business... Read more...
title: Fundamentals of Standardization and ISO
headline: Gain an understanding of standardization, its basic aspects and different forms of standards in this free online course.
description: The practice of standardization has long existed in the professional world. It consists of ways through which the businesses and companies ensure the consistency of their final products. Moreover, it also helps governments streamline their administrative operations. Through this short course, you will be able to gather essential insights into different fundamental aspects of standardization, types of standards, their importance and benefits.
courseDescription:
The concept of standardization is almost as old as human civilization itself. Ancient cultures, such as those belonging to the Indus Valley Civilization, implemented different practices for streamlining their daily economic and trading activities. Nowadays, standardization has become an integral component of every industrial sector. Whether it is trading or business, applying standards is the norm. Today, it is almost impossible for any business to compete without adhering to some form of standard.

To help you understand the importance of standardization and its related concepts, Exoexcellence Consultants have developed this concise course. It consists of a single module with four essential topics. These topics contain versatile content, with the material discussing different aspects of standardization, such as its history and purpose. Furthermore, it also briefly explains the process of standard development at the International Organization of Standards (ISO) and mentions the four common types of standards in practice across the world.

The developers of this course have also made sure to add the importance of certification and accreditation to this course. Moreover, the course discusses process standards with their classifications. You will discover important considerations regarding verification and certification, certification bodies, first-party verification and second-party verification. Lastly, we outline the benefits of standardization for companies, consumers and governments. A lesson summary will reinforce your learning before taking the brief assessment and applying for certification.

Start Course Now

Once you have completed this course, you have the option to acquire an official Diploma, which is a great way to share your achievement with the world.

Your Alison is:

  • An indication of your commitment to continuously learn, upskill & achieve high results.
  • An incentive for you to continue empowering yourself through lifelong learning.
Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:

  • : a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked , posted to you with FREE shipping.

All are available to purchase through the Alison Shop. For more information on purchasing Alison , please visit our FAQs. If you decide not to purchase your Alison , you can still demonstrate your achievement by sharing your Learner Record or Learner Achievement Verification, both of which are accessible from your Dashboard. slides:
• Learning Outcomes

  • Having completed this module you will be able to:
    • Discuss the importance of standardization in businesses and trading
    • Identify the process of standard development at ISO
    • Define the four common types of standards and their implications
    • Classify standards according to their developers and formality
    • Evaluate the process of certification and accreditation 
    • Outline the benefits of standardization for companies, consumers, and governments

  • Introduction to Standardization

  • What is Standardization?

  • Select an Image from the Gallery

  • Standard is an agreed code of conduct to which all the parties of an industry or organization need to prove their compliance. Standardization is the process of developing and applying technical standards formulated through the consensus of various parties that include users, firms, interested parties, standards organizations, and even regulatory bodies.
  • A Brief History of Standardization

  • Select an Image from the Gallery

  • The historical roots of standardization go as far as the Indus Valley civilization. During that era, a centralized weight and measure system was developed to ease the merchants in their business transactions. In this regard, smaller weight measures were used to measure luxury items and larger ones for users to measure heavier items.
  • With technical standardization, using gauging devices for angular measurement also became accessible. Standard uniform units of measuring length were also used in town planning of famous settlements, such as Mohenjo Daro, Harappa, Lothal, Kalibangan, Dolavira, Surkotada, etc. The standard weight and length measures from the Indus Valley civilization also made their way to Persia and Central Asia, where they were modified further.

  • What is Standard According to ISO?

  • According to ISO, standardization is as follows:

  • Select an Image from the Gallery

  • "Documented agreements containing technical specifications or other precise criteria to be used consistently as rules, guidelines or definitions, to ensure that materials, products, processes and services are fit for their purpose"
  • Thus, this definition of standardization by ISO shows that standards serve the purpose of standardization as well as of the guidelines.
  • Objectives of Standardization 
  • The main objectives of standardization are to ensure that everyone adheres to the same procedures and specifications. This comes with various benefits, such as
    • Ease of logistics
    • Trade facilitation
    • Prevention of consumer deception, and
    • Improvement in overall quality

  • "Documented agreements containing technical specifications or other precise criteria to be used consistently as rules, guidelines or definitions, to ensure that materials, products, processes and services are fit for their purpose"
  • Thus, this definition of standardization by ISO shows that standards serve the purpose of standardization as well as of the guidelines.
  • Objectives of Standardization 
  • The main objectives of standardization are to ensure that everyone adheres to the same procedures and specifications. This comes with various benefits, such as
    • Ease of logistics
    • Trade facilitation
    • Prevention of consumer deception, and
    • Improvement in overall quality

  • Lesson Summary

  • Purpose of Standardization
    • Ensures that the organization performs all of its processes by adhering to the guidelines set by the standard
    • Ensure that the final product is consistent in quality, and
    • Maintain a level of uniformity so that certain practices or operations can be conducted within the selected environment
  • How does Standardization Work?
    • By creating the service,
    • By determining the method of operating a business, and
    • By determining the way how certain processes are governed
